channel.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
channel.description:
i have a server, it's online, but if i chance player-rights to 3, and startup my server, NOTHING, it's not helping. Same with the other things, if i chance java.client, save, i startup my server, NOTHING AGAIN. the old settings! Please help me. btw i'm using testscape.
Sorry for bad english, i'm dutch.
~Baloeh[br][size=1]Posted at: December 10, 2006, 09:18:30 AM[/size][hr]C'mon do nobody knows?

item.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:6, topic:33959”]Holy crap you guys.

Have your character file open. Be logged OFF the account you are making a staff member. Change the character-rights from 0 to 1, 2, or 3. Close and SAVE your character file. Log back on the account. Ta-da.[/quote]
finally another person with common sense. One is saying you have to be logged on and the other says you have to use the client.java

Read full topic

item.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Holy crap you guys.

Have your character file open. Be logged OFF the account you are making a staff member. Change the character-rights from 0 to 1, 2, or 3. Close and SAVE your character file. Log back on the account. Ta-da.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
item.dc:creator: @SheppehSays SheppehSays
item.description:
@SheppehSays wrote:

baez9:

Lol… for the setting to work like if you edit something in client.java you must COMPILE then if u didn’t get any errors restart and the settings will take place but with the char files you must be logged out for the setting to save.

Lol… all of you fail…
« on: December 10, 2006, 02:36:38 pm »

Read full topic

item.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

[quote=“DRAGON GIRL, post:2, topic:33959”]try to have your char files open and have your file open with character rights 3 -dont save yet
log in then save
log out then save and log back in maybe that will work?[/quote]
fail. You must be logged out to save your char file as when you do log out it overwrites the previous one. Just make sure you are off and it should be perfectly fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Mod/Admin and others. HELP
item.dc:creator: @DRAGON_GIRL DRAGON GIRL
item.description:
@DRAGON_GIRL wrote:

try to have your char files open and have your file open with character rights 3 -dont save yet
log in then save
log out then save and log back in maybe that will work?
